content: We're not going to win a war on an ideal, just like we didn't/won't win the wars on: Drugs Poverty Homelessness AIDS Oh, and as far as us winning the war on communism, we haven't completely won that one, either as communism is still alive and well all over the world.......over 50 years later.

title: not a global war on terrorism?

content: If you were able to ask the Iraqis, "Are you better off now than you were under Saddam Hussein?" They would answer: "No!" He may have been a vicious dictator and they may have despised him but Iraq was peaceful. The Iraqis had electricity and food and a life. Now they have little or none of the advantages that they had under Saddam, SOB that he was. So, what good have we brought them?
reply: If you were able to ask the Iraqis, "Are you better off now than you were under Saddam Hussein?" They would answer: "No!" content: quote: Originally posted by mrmixitup: We're not going to win a war on an ideal, just like we didn't/won't win the wars on: Drugs [Yet a bunch of fools want to leaglize and thereby further encourage the soul-killing addictions. We should apply Singapore's policies for drugs.] Poverty [Yup. Been pi**ing away tens of trillions on that one for 44 years; unwinnable, sicne the more people get handouts, the lower their motivation to improve; three generations of welfare suckers in some areas.] Homelessness [Increases drastically when a pachyderm takes the Presidency; decreases drastically when a jacakss is in office.] AIDS [Moral sexual behavior goes a long, long way to keeping this in line.] Oh, and as far as us winning the war on communism, we haven't completely won that one, either as communism is still alive and well all over the world.......over 50 years later. We won the Cold War. That was what was required, and we did it; thanks especially to Ronald Reagan, Margaret Thatcher, and the Pope. (Yeah, I know that idiots tell us it was Uncle Gorby who "led the way." His butt was in a severe crack, thanks to US strategy and the systemic evils of an enforced collective economy. He did what he had to, to keep his empire from falling apart sooner.) As far as the evil of enforced collectivism is concerned (commies, nazis), they will be with us until the End of Days. So recognizing them and the paths to their evils and engaging and destroying such evils shall remain our duty, if we merit freedom. Noting when we are heading down the path to socialism is a prime means to be aware of when the evils of such collectivism are upon us.
